ficonTEC Ireland is located inside Tyndall National Institute in the city of Cork, 253 km from the capital of Ireland, Dublin. ficonTEC Ireland is part of ficonTEC Service GmbH, a leading manufacturer of automated assembly and test equipment for several technical market areas, such as telecommunications, Lidar, Metrology, and assembly of high-quality optical beam lines, such as cameras.

Description:
Your Contribution:
Procad Engineering shares a passion for lifelong learning. By joining us, you will receive comprehensive and structured professional training and development support, a collaborative environment and exposure to all aspects of delivering leading industrial facilities. Since our opening in 1995, we have grown into a significant multidisciplinary engineering firm delivering substantial projects for Food & Beverage, Pharmaceutical, Medical Device, and Semiconductor manufacturing clients in Ireland and abroad.
People are our greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package, leading work-life balance and flexibility. We are ready to accommodate flexible, part-time and hybrid working conditions suitable to you and our organisation.
You will become an essential part of the team, assisting the delivery of industrial facilities with your mechanical design and project management experience. We offer a dynamic and rewarding career as part of the industry-leading and recognised multidisciplinary consultancy working on challenging and exciting projects for some of the biggest names in Ireland.

Job_title: Graduate Geologist, Engineering Geologist, Geotechnical Engineer
Description:
Ground Investigations Ireland are recruiting Geologists, Engineering Geologists and Geotechnical Engineers at graduate level for a number of positions. The successful candidate will work on a broad range of Geotechnical projects. The role will focus mainly on geotechnical projects with an overlap with parallel geo-environmental site investigations.
The role will be based in our Dublin office while also working on a diverse range of projects throughout the country.
As this is a graduate role full training and mentoring will be provided by a senior Engineer/Geologist.
Competitive salary.

SSVFX is an internationally acclaimed visual effects house based in Dublin, Ireland with offices in
Los Angeles and London. SSVFX caters for big-budget feature film work, independent feature films and high-end TV series. SSVFX are proud to boast an array of awards and nominations that include a
VES win for Game of Thrones, as well as other BAFTA, VES, HPA, RTS, AEAF and IFTA nominations and wins.
SSVFX is continuing to develop its range of service offerings, building authentic and long-lasting connections with clients across the industry.
Job Description:
The VFX Systems Engineer (SE) is an integral part of our technology team. Reporting to the Head of
Technology, the SE role offers candidates an incredible opportunity to advance their technical skills in one of Ireland’s leading visual effects studios. As we continue to grow, we are looking for a skilled
SE to join our team and help shape the future of visual effects technology in Ireland.

Your Contribution:
Procad Engineering shares a passion for lifelong learning. By joining us, you will receive comprehensive and structured professional training and development support, a collaborative environment and exposure to all aspects of delivering leading industrial facilities. Since our opening in 1995, we have grown into a significant multidisciplinary engineering firm delivering substantial projects for Food & Beverage, Pharmaceutical, Medical Device, and Semiconductor manufacturing clients in Ireland and abroad.
People are our greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package, leading work-life balance and flexibility. We are ready to accommodate flexible, part-time and hybrid working conditions suitable to you and our organisation.
You will become an essential part of the team, assisting the delivery of industrial facilities with your architectural design and project management experience. We offer a dynamic and rewarding career as part of the industry-leading and recognised multidisciplinary consultancy working on challenging and exciting projects for some of the biggest names in Ireland.

Description:
The candidate will be expected to travel to various client sites in the greater Leinster area, gather and collect on site technical data and generate BER and Energy Improvement reports based on their findings. The role will require the candidate to provide individual customers with bespoke reports and advice on the best energy upgrades applicable to them.
While the list of skills and competencies given below are an advantage they are not all essential as training can and will be provided. Evolved Energy Solutions will provide the candidate with on the job training in any areas they feel it is required. We are looking for a BER experienced or similar operative for this role.
Have completed and successfully passed the BER assessor training course
Have a construction based Level 7 Qualification

Role: Splunk Engineer
Job Type: Permanent
Location: Letterkenny (Hybrid)

Want to future proof your career with a leading global IT Consultancy company?
Do you have solid experience with Splunk Enterprise Security or integration with other SIEM platforms?
Join Tata Consultancy Services as a Splunk Engineer!

Careers at TCS: It means more
TCS is a purpose-led transformation company, built on belief. We don’t just help businesses to transform through technology. We support them in making a meaningful difference to the people and communities they serve - our clients include some of the biggest brands in Ireland and worldwide. For you, it means more opportunity to make an impact that matters, through challenging projects which demand ambitious innovation.


As a , you will support Splunk Enterprise Security administration and management, managing enterprise SIEM infrastructure to improve data ingestions processes, including architectural work. You will provide overall engineering and design support for a distributed Splunk environment consisting of heavy forwarders, indexers, and search head servers, spanning security, performance, and operational roles.




TCS is consistently voted a Top Employer in the UK&I and globally. Our competitive salary packages feature pension, health care, life assurance, laptop, phone, access to extensive training resources and discounts within the larger Tata network.


At TCS, we believe in building and sustaining a culture of equity and belonging where everyone can thrive. Our diversity motto is ‘Inclusion without Exception’.

We encourage applications from all sections of society. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, sex, pregnancy and maternity, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

TCS is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to its employees and applicants for employment to ensure that individuals with disabilities enjoy equal access to all employment opportunities. If you are an applicant who needs an accommodation due to a disability to complete an employment application or during any phase of the hiring process, please contact us at with the subject line: "Disability Accommodation Request".

- A primary degree in Electrical Engineering
- extensive experience in an electrical engineering role
- data centre experience
Package on offer:

Background:
Hello, we’re Piper, a 28-year-old Irish Company
We provide metering, sampling and automated data collections systems for the Dairy industry. We export products to the UK, Australia, New Zealand and the US, as well as servicing the Irish market.
In order to pursue growth opportunities for the business, we have created a position for a Product Engineer.
We are looking for a hands-on engineer, who has strong electro-mechanical-systems experience, excellent project management capability and a proven track record of problem solving & delivery. This role will be customer facing and will require some travel to the US and on occasion to other locations.

Company description
Ashdown Controls Limited are among the largest installers and service providers of Building Management Systems in Ireland and the UK. We have grown steadily in the past number of years to become one of the largest independent providers of Integrated Building Energy Management Systems.
Job description
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
· Engineering of BMS Systems (Upgrades)
· Service of BMS Systems (Planned Preventative Maintenance)

We have a vacancy for a Quality Engineer.
Duties will include the following:
Development of inspection, work instructions, control plans
Part inspection, including: layout, in process, final, and receiving using all types of mechanical inspection, Preparation of inspection reports
Coordination and performance of internal process/product audits
Performance process capability studies
Must be capable of leading and carrying out customers ppap requirements

We are hiring a Senior Test & Balancing Commissioning Engineer within the HVAC Commissioning & Cleanroom Certification industries.
This is a great career opportunity to learn and work for one of Ireland & the UK's top HVAC Commissioning Companies. We work predominately in the Building Services, Life Sciences, Pharmaceutical & Data Centre industries.
You will be working with a talented, collaborative, and intelligent team of colleagues, contributing to a wide range of engineering projects. Duties will include:
*
Responsible for commissioning, troubleshooting, testing of HVAC systems
HVAC Air and Water Systems Balancing and Commissioning

PEMSERTER In-Die Engineer
Location: Galway



The In-Die Engineer is a key member of the In-Die team whose main role involves:
· Design and development of In-Die tooling and systems · Support In-Die tooling installs and system commissions
In-Die office responsibilities including the creation and maintenance of documents and systems to ensure that our products are designed, manufactured & assembled to the correct standards and by the correct process
Communication - verbal and written, externally with customers & distributors and internally with sales, operations, engineering, quality, purchasing etc


Mechanical engineering aptitude
Electrical/electronic engineering aptitude
Technical drawing skills
Documentation control
Accuracy and conscientiousness are necessary for success in the role · Ability to work with minimal supervision - setting priorities & time management
Confident and competent communicator, verbal and written - with management, external sales, distributors, customers etc.
Confidence, ability and consent to travel throughout Europe - conceivably frequently and at short notice


Data sheet evaluation, preparation of costings/quotes, tool design, die review/feedback, managing the manufacture, assembly, testing, packaging & dispatch of In-Die systems and supporting tool installation and system commission.
Responsible for multiple projects at any one time
Create & modify drawings as necessary and maintain relevant documentation
Maintain the PEMSERTER® In-Die workshop/tooling preparation area to a high standard.
Stock management of PEMSERTER® In-Die parts, ensuring adequate stock levels are maintained to fulfil customer requirements
Add and maintain parts on JDE:
Bills of Materials
Routers
Product Masters


Generate Work Orders
Issue material
Assemble and validate tooling
Assign design, assembly and packaging hours to close out work order

Create & modify procedures & work instructions whilst maintaining documentation control

The above list is not exhaustive, the duties and responsibilities highlighted in this job description are indicative and may vary over time due to business demands. Employees are expected to undertake other duties and responsibilities relevant to the nature, level and scope of their role.

Autodesk Inventor, JDE, ECN Database, GQMS Database


Engineering qualification - discipline flexible
Mechanical Engineering aptitude

Job Description


REQ ID: 105321
JOB TITLE: Senior Systems Engineer
SALARY: Competitive
LOCATION: Shannon, Ireland

Dreaming for tomorrow is about more than ideas and ambitions. We're already building the next generation of vehicles, using repurposed and brand-new technology and techniques. We're doing more than dream, we're creating the future of mobility and automotive for years to come.



An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Senior Systems Engineer here at Jaguar Land Rover Ireland. We are looking for someone with previous experience to undertake this new role and make a difference. If you are passionate and driven this could be the perfect fit for you and a great chance to work with one of the most prestigious automotive brands in the world.

Expect to be operating within a multi-disciplinary product team, the team is responsible for creating and developing new (and improving existing) location service products. It is crucial for the successful candidate to have strong collaboration skills and have an innovative mindset.

Empowered to lead technical aspects of the engineering tasks, to support the Product Owner in identifying creative ways to maximize the delivery of the product roadmap and backlog, whilst recognizing dependencies, gaps and risks.

The role requires a strong system level understanding of the functionality and use cases of Vehicle Positioning, Electronic Horizon and Map Data across in-vehicle applications. Deploying and delivering innovative service solutions to enhance vehicle performance and driver experiences for our most discerning of customers.



You will need to be proficient working within a multi-disciplinary product team to define the system design and requirements for vehicle positioning and electronic horizon services. It is imperative that you are empowered to make technical decisions in order to solve problems aligned to a defined product vision, mission, and goals.

As this is a role that needs a strong level of communication you must be proficient in facilitating stakeholder collaboration as requested in order to put the customer needs first. You will be required to maintain technical knowledge through research and supplier engagement in order to collaborate on the strategic approach of the product and be able to develop this further.

Dreaming for tomorrow is about more than ideas and ambitions. We're already building the next generation of vehicles, using repurposed and brand-new technology and techniques. We're doing more than dream, we're creating the future of mobility and automotive for years to come.



The main purpose of this role is to support the complete life cycle of new/modified software product, from research and design to implementation, training and support in the cloud.

You will work with lead engineers to write and modify programmes; testing code; diagnosing faults in software; and designing programmes to solve those faults. All these tasks typically involve a detailed and meticulous problem-solving process. Fundamentally, it is imperative you have working knowledge of software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.

JOB TITLE: Senior AutoSAR Developer
SALARY: Competitive
LOCATION: Shannon, Ireland

Dreaming for tomorrow is about more than ideas and ambitions. We're already building the next generation of vehicles, using repurposed and brand-new technology and techniques. We're doing more than dream, we're creating the future of mobility and automotive for years to come.



This position is for a Senior Embedded Software Engineer within Jaguar Land Rovers Software Development team in Ireland, delivering the software platform for our next generation vehicle architecture. Software development will include the definition, configuration and integration of AUTOSAR Basic Software components - for classic frameworks. We offer a dynamic work environment, the chance to grow within the company and to develop your competences in new technologies. This is a great role where you will be working with a supportive team and on exciting new products and technologies including automotive Ethernet networks, multicore application hosting and SOTA.

This position is for a highly motivated and experienced automotive engineer with responsibility for the design, development and delivery of our next generation software platform in an Autosar framework. You will have a record of production software development and delivery through all stages of the engineering development V cycle regarding software artefacts, requirements cascade, design, implementation, validation, and verification in an AUTOSAR compliant framework. You will be involved in the support of Autosar communication software within existing architectures with clarification of requirements, configuration parameters and tooling support.

Working with a team of System, Architecture, Hardware, Software and Controls Engineers, you'll aim to deliver concept and production systems in a timely manner, according to vehicle programme timing and local delivery milestones, whilst overseeing issue investigation and ECU diagnosis.

The key responsibilities of the job include:
Ensuring that proposed changes to products are systematically analyzed before implementation, working cross-functionally with project management, quality, manufacturing, regulatory, clinical, and marketing teams, collaborating with manufacturing to reduce product costs.

Description:
R&D Manager - Photochromic and Liquid Crystal Technology Company

Overview:

Over 25 years of successful Research and Development has positioned us as the market leader in light intelligent lenses. As part of the EssilorLuxottica Group, we transform lives by enabling people to engage with the world and to fully express themselves. We are all about living Seamlessly. That's what our products enable, whether it's changing from light to dark without breaking stride. Or the freedom of using a product that's so perfect for you that you forget you're even wearing it. It's what our company does. Whether that's through innovating in both style and technology, together, seamlessly. The team is responsible for developing alternative technologies and manufacturing methods to combine photochromic and liquid crystal technology. You will be leading R&D projects to push the boundaries of the most innovative family of products in the optical sector, combining excellent photochromic performance and adaptive polarization.

Description:
Process Engineer – Pharmaceuticals – 12 Month Contract – Dublin

We have a fantastic contract opportunity for an experienced Process Engineer based in Dublin. If you are looking for the chance to join a pharmaceutical organisation in their mission to change lives and drive innovation, this is the role for you.

Located 15 minutes from Dublin Airport and just a short distance from the lively, vibrant, and cultural Irish capital, this leading biopharmaceutical organisation paves the way with state-of-the-art technology on their one-of-a-kind manufacturing facility.

As a Process Engineer, you will be improving operations, identification potential process issues and vulnerabilities, investigations into process abnormalities, and troubleshooting.

Responsibilities as a Process Engineer:
Responsible for providing technical support for commercial manufacturing processes across site, including engineering support for existing equipment and manufacturing processes.
Reviewing process data, identify and report outliers
Identify opportunities to improve process reliability, repeatability, compliance and consistency
Monitor process data and review methods, facilities and equipment design to ensure operational and process consistency
Assists in the design review of equipment and facilities
Assist in the assessment of manufacturing requirements and capabilities prior to the transfer of new processes into the manufacturing facilities
Management and co-ordination of process optimization projects.
Planning and execution of all process testing in adherence to site safety procedures.


8-10 years in a process engineering/optimization role
Detailed knowledge of Bulk Drug Substance unit operations from a design and operation perspective – Bioreactors, UFDF Skids, Chromatography Operations
Relevant Drug Substance experience as subject matter expert / engineer.
Experience in using Delta V automation platform essential.
Experience in issue description, root cause identification, technical/quality impact assessment & corrective action justification.
Degree in Chemical/Process/Mechanical Engineering or greater preferred.
Does this sound like a job for you? If you have the above experience and would like more information, please apply now, to be contacted ASAP.

The candidate must have the rights to work in the location stated in the job advert.

Please note, Quanta part of QCS Staffing does not sponsor Visa applications.

Description:
Process Validation Engineer – Pharmaceuticals – Contract – Cork

Are you interested in joining a world leading biopharmaceutical company, focussed on developing advanced and innovative treatments for those suffering with rare diseases? Our client is currently seeking a Process Validation Engineer.

This is a fantastic opportunity to work in a state-of-the-art facility in Cork. You will be joining a leading Biopharmaceutical company who focus on a range of products which are life-changing for individuals.

Process Validation Engineer Responsibilities:
Play a significant role in the documentation and support for release of manufacturing systems and processes for cGMP use
Successfully complete projects in a timely manner supporting company goals and objectives
Assist with preparation of regulatory filings, with answering questions from regulatory agencies, and with presentations of materials during regulatory inspections/partner audits.
Development and implementation of SOPs/Guideline documents with systemic procedural improvements.
Determine methods and procedures on new assignments with supervision and in accordance with developed practices and procedures.
Perform process validation activities related to the drug substance and drug products, through defined clinical and commercial stages.
Execute process validation activities related to the implementation of process changes and new processes.


Degree qualified in relevant technical discipline (engineering, chemical or biological sciences)
6+ years’ experience in a cGMP regulated manufacturing environment
Knowledge or proficiency in process validation, process sciences and change control.
Organizational and management skills.
Ability to communicate with, present data to, and defend approaches in front of a variety of audiences.
Ability to comprehend scientific/technical information related to equipment, processes, and regulatory expectations.
Understanding and demonstrated knowledge of regulatory requirements, guidelines, and recommendations for process validation expectations.
Proficiency with technical writing.
Proficiency with standard office software applications, including MS package.
Are you a good fit for this Process Validation Engineer position? Apply with us today.

Description:
We’re Analytic Partners. Founded in 2000, Analytic Partners is the world’s premier technology driven, people enabled, analytic solution provider. Our mission is to turn data into expertise by enabling stronger brand connections to drive competitive advantage and deliver growth for our customers.
We offer a cloud-based, managed software platform which delivers adaptive solutions for deeper business understanding and right-time planning and optimization for marketing and beyond. We work with top-tier companies across the globe in a wide range of industries Including: Automotive, Consumer & Business Technology, Consumer Goods, Financial Services, Retail & Restaurants, Telco & Entertainment, Travel & Hospitality, and Wine, Beer & Spirits.
We’re growing fast with global operations across our full-service offices in New York City, Miami, Denver, Charlottesville, Dublin, London, Paris, Hamburg, Munich, Sydney, Melbourne, Singapore, and Shanghai.

The Data Engineer will help AP’s vision of turning data into expertise. At the core, this role is responsible for creating workflows for data ingestion, standardizing processes and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load). Leverage SQL scripts to design and automate workflows to ingest and load data to different target databases and systems. This exciting opportunity will put you at the forefront of cutting-edge technologies as we continue to expand our solutions over time. This role will be an integral part of shaping the development suite for our next-generation analytic solutions designed and built for our global clients. We work within an agile environment.

APC Ltd is an award-winning and rapidly growing science- and technology-driven pharmaceutical process research company. In the space of 5 years, we have pioneered innovation in the sector and we now partner with 8 of the top-10 pharma and 5 of the top-10 biotech firms in the world.
From our world-class facility, we offer specialised chemical and process engineering solutions. Powered by novel technology and world-class scientific research, we help companies accelerate the development & launch of their medicines.
Our rapid growth has come from a commitment to excellence, a drive to innovate and the desire to develop a challenging, creative, and rewarding environment for our team. If you are interested in a career focused on technical innovation, technology design and impact, we would love to hear from you.
About the team
Department: Technical Operations
Reports to: Engineering Functional Lead
Our Engineering team comprises of highly qualified, capable, and welcoming colleagues. We support our clients by delivering world class pharmaceutical process research and development to accelerate the delivery of quality, life-changing medicines to the patient across a wide range of therapeutic areas. Now more than ever the opportunities are greater as technology enhances our capability to make a real difference to patients.
Our team vision is to enhance the process development experience for our clients in a dynamic and cross-collaborative environment, with application of best in class chemical engineering techniques, modelling workflows, and technologies.
If you are looking to further your career in a cutting-edge dynamic, creative, and patient focussed environment then APC is for you.
Principal Duties and Objectives

Working within a research team, support the planning, organising and delivery of R&D pharmaceutical and/or biopharmaceutical research projects.
Develop pharmaceutical and/or biopharmaceutical scale-up and optimisation strategies through application of engineering workflows and modelling tools which support the successful tech transfer of the final product to our partners. Create scale down pharmaceutical and biopharmaceutical processes to understand and optimise large scale operations.
Prepare and review technical presentations and report material, and present the issues, results and project progress to clients as required.
Based on project needs, develop, and introduce new techniques, methods, and processes to improve business effectiveness.
Demonstrate the use of problem-solving skills requiring the application of engineering principles, calculations, and computational methods in approaching technical challenges.
Adopt, maintain, and improve on APC’s engineering workflows and their incorporation into the day-to-day execution of commercial research projects and internal innovation strands.
Where applicable, coach mentor and train junior team members.

Laboratory Duties

Provide R&D laboratory support across APC’s Small and/or Large Molecule portfolio through collaboration with scientists and engineers, both internally and externally.
Perform process development work on Small or Large Molecule unit operations.
Ensure that operation to GLP standard within a R&D laboratory is always maintained.
Monitor, develop and optimise pharmaceutical and/or biopharmaceutical reaction and purification unit processes.
Where applicable, support the execution of commercial and innovation R&D projects using engineering modelling tools such as CFD, Matlab, Python, MVDA, Dynochem etc.
Solve complex technical problems and take responsibility for implementing the solutions using an Engineering first approach.
Ensure clear technical reports are written with sound conclusions. Author and review reports as required. Ensure lab book write-up review/closeout is completed.
Ensure that safe working practices are adhered to in line with relevant local and legal requirements.
Liaise with the Laboratory Coordinator, Facilities Supervisor, Area Owners and Equipment Owners as required to maintain a shared awareness of the issues requiring attention within the laboratories.

Minimum Requirements

PhD in Chemical or Bio Engineering or related area; or Msc in Chemical or Bio Engineering or related area; or Bachelors in Chemical or Bio Engineering or related area.
Minimum of 1-2+ years industry experience in pharmaceutical and/or biopharmaceutical process research and development.
Experience in pharmaceutical /biopharmaceutical Engineering
Ability to work in a dynamic and multidisciplinary environment
Self-motivated with demonstrated project management skills
Excellent technical communications skills, with previous technical presentation experience
Ability to disseminate information to research team and directors

Desirable Skills

Proficient in PAT for the development of pharmaceutical/Bio Pharmaceutical processes (FBRM, ATR-FTIR, Raman etc)
Experience in the use of statistical analysis and data driven computational methods
Skilled in the application of chemical engineering fundamentals (Process and/or reaction modelling)
Skilled in lab techniques (Aseptic, material handling wet chemistry)
Proficient in working across various engineering unit ops (e.g. crystallization, drying, TFF)
Good understanding of DoE and QbD for process development
Experience with scale-up techniques for processes from laboratory to plant scale
Background and grounding in MATLAB, DynoChem, Python, CFD, MVDA and JMP.

How to apply
Suitable candidates should submit a CV and a Cover Letter by close of business 12th April 2023
APC is committed to the principle of equal opportunity for all employees. All employment decisions at APC are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to gender, ethnicity, age, religious belief, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital status, or any other status protected by Irish law.
Similar vacancies arising in the coming 6 months may be filled from this group of applicants.
Salary

The salary is negotiable and dependent on the experience of the successful candidate.

Description:
Location Ireland/UK
Are you a developer with full stack experience? Do you have a passion for educating and assisting other developers to get the most out of their development process? Do you crave new challenges and a variety of projects?
We are looking for developers who are motivated to learn something new and contribute as a member of our Development team. The Development team not only educates our customers and their development teams on how to use the Invicara Twinit.io platform, but also helps our customers design and develop their own applications on Twinit.io. At Invicara our developers not only create user interfaces for applications, but also the underlying business logic and data models. Our Twinit.io platform, provides a schema-less backend that supports flexible data models to be defined by the applications themselves. That means developers will not only be defining the front-end components and user interface, but also the business logic for the application and how the application will persist and access data in our Twinit.io platform, custom APIs, and even scripted server-side routines and data integrations.

Munich Re is one of the world's largest reinsurers providing solutions for complex risks to 40 million clients in over 30 countries.
Munich Re Automation Solutions are the market leader in providing new business processing and underwriting automation solutions to the life insurance industry. The Automation Solutions division of Munich Re delivers exceptional solution-based expertise that enables straight through processing (STP), increases sales and reduces costs for life insurers worldwide.
Munich Re Automation Solutions have enabled STP and "instant issue" for insurers and banks globally, who are now able to auto-assess the majority of new applications at the point of sale for a variety of life insurance products across the full spectrum of distribution channels. This has been accompanied by a significant reduction in new business acquisition costs.

Description:
Description
¿Who are we?
We are ARATECH, a technology consulting firm, born 10 years ago to provide efficient solutions to our clients. Within our business lines we help our partners to find the best talent for their work teams.

¿Who's our partner?
Is a global EPC company that has 40 years of experience in the Middle East, Asia, US & European markets. We are now recruiting for key Engineering positions to deliver large-scale, multi-discipline projects from its Engineering office in Ireland.

What will be your tasks in this position?
A new multi-billion $ project for one of the world’s largest Oil & Gas producers is commencing and Front-End Engineering Design (FEED) is required to thoroughly plan this major project.

Clonmel, Ireland

Process Engineers are responsible for the Conceptual, Pre-FEED study from the concept to detail engineering.

What do they offer you?
Work-life balance
Hybrid working available (2 days at home)
Pension
Weekly coffee mornings
Parking
Career Path
Relocation assistance
Initial housing assistance
Social activities
Lots of fun!!!
Requirements


Strong Gas processing or LNG experience.
Good understanding of process technologies for Gas processing and able to work independently, take the lead in developing process design.
Liaising with other discipline, third parties or licensors.
Delivery focused and able to meet deadline.
Assist in developing process design data and criteria.
Applies process design criteria and guidelines to all phases of process engineering.
Develop Piping & Instrumentation Diagram (P&ID) according to the process.
Lead 30%, 60%, 90% & IFC Design Review & Coordination.
Contribute value awareness concepts to Process design regarding cost focus.
Perform process calculations for complex systems.
Awareness on sustainable design practices and technologies.
Forecast, plan and manage Individual & Team workload, Progress against agreed plan and criteria.
Suggest modifications to develop and design to enhance quality.
Prepare specifications and datasheets in accordance with project requirements to ensure all compliances are met.
Take part in inter-discipline coordination work between engineers from other disciplines to ensure quality and interfacing.
Understands obligations and authority to make appropriate design decisions necessary for plant safety and operability.

Qualifications
Degree in Process/Chemical/Mechanical Engineering.

Essential Requirements
Minimum of 5 years experience in Oil & Gas Industry.
Experience in the Oil & Gas processing & LNG industry is essential.

Advantageous Requirements
Saudi Aramco project experience will be advantageous.
Excellent written and oral English skills.
Strong organizational, planning and coordination, People Management skills.
Strong technical, prioritization and management skills.
Good communication, influencing and interface skills.
Experience in Process Design Software programs such as ASPEN, ANSYS or Similar.

5 years

Reporting to the Senior Quality Engineering, duties will include active participation in non-conformance investigations, quality metric generation, conducting internal audits and complaints investigation. The successful candidate will be working in the quality department providing real time support to the Senior Quality Engineer. This will include assisting the Senior Quality Engineer in the development of production process controls, CAPA systems, quality metrics, reporting systems and will be required to conduct occasional process audits. This is an ideal role for a Quality Technician/Engineer Graduate looking to gain experience in ISO9001, AS9100 and ISO13485.
*Key Responsibilities
• Help develop and implement quality metrics and reporting system
• Analysis of data, quality metrics and tre

Tech Skills:

Job_title: Member of Technical Staff II - Opportunity for Working Remotely , Dublin
Description:
We are looking for a talented Full Stack Software Engineer to join our team!
The VMware Engineering Services team builds web-based UI components and interfaces which provide consistent experiences across VMware products. The UI portfolio includes products that deliver enterprise scale self-service data centers on top of a virtualization platform for compute, storage, and networking. Our applications enable IT managers, administrators, and non-technical users to navigate and manage a world with large amounts of heterogeneous applications. You will apply your imagination and skillset to create experiences that delight our customers.
You will join a world-class team respected for its innovation and execution. We are based in Palo Alto on the main campus with great facilities and a comfortable working environment. If you love shipping software that extends the technology frontier, then this is for you!






VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

Job_title: Software Engineer, Data Pipelines - Opportunity for Working Remotely Cork,
Description:
The Elevator Pitch: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?
This is an opportunity to make an impact at the intersection of two of the most transformative technologies of this decade – 5G and AI/ML. VMware is looking for a highly motivated software engineer to join its product R&D team that is developing a data-driven intelligent controller platform for 5G mobile networks worldwide.

In this role, you will develop data pipeline services for handling large-scale network telemetry data from a variety of 5G network sources. Depending on the type of data, these services may be handling hundreds of thousands to millions of events per second via a cloud-based distributed architecture, and processing tens to hundreds of GBs per second of data across thousands of nodes. You will also develop APIs to expose these services to 3rd-party developers and work with a large ecosystem of VMware commercial partners (and VMware internal developers) who will use your APIs to develop their respective AI/ML-based applications. You will work closely with fellow platform engineers, operations engineers, UI/UX engineers, product managers, SREs and other cross-functional teams to deliver carrier-grade software products to 5G service providers around the globe. In the process, you will collaborate closely with experts in the fields of cloud, AI/ML and 5G, and work in an environment that provides ample learning and career growth opportunities.









VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

Job_title: Senior Software Engineer – CargoWise Customs, Ireland
Description:
Autonomy, Mastery and Purpose. Our mission is to deliver breakthrough products that enable and empower those that own and operate the supply chains of the world. Our vision and mission drive everything that we do and are at the core of our strategy. Our people sit at the centre of all of this.
WiseTech Global provides the world’s most comprehensive solution for companies operating in the increasingly complex world of logistics. It has never been a more important time for organisations to have a resilient supply chain. Our industry-leading flagship product, CargoWise, is centralising logistics operations on a single global database, delivering business continuity, scalability and security.
At the very core of this is our CargoWise Native Customs functionality. This platform accounts for over 45% of global manufactured trade flows, a number that is growing year on year. The work you do in this team has a genuine, meaningful real world impact. So if you are an ambitious engineer, who wants to solve deeply complex problems with others of a similar mindset, read on.

Job_title: NET software development engineer, Tanzu - Opportunity for Working Remotely Cork,
Description:
Your next adventure at VMware is only a click away!
At VMware, we are committed to helping our people grow professionally. Our talented employees exemplify our shared values and continue to drive our company to new heights.
If you see a position that might be right for you, we encourage you to apply and continue to be a part of our EPIC2 community.
Job Description
Working in the .NET Experience program will provide you with an opportunity to create a state-of-the-art experience for .NET developers utilizing our Tanzu product portfolio. You will be working with a dedicated team of professionals with a goal to provide a streamlined approach to building applications on cloud platforms. This position will give you the opportunity to work directly on open-source developer productivity tools and with a variety of teams across VMware with similar goals. You will develop innovative solutions and integrations throughout our VMware Tanzu portfolio using technologies like Kubernetes, Tilt, cloud-native buildpacks to create a connected experience between developers and the platforms that run their applications.






VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

Description:
Cloud Engineer ( Data Analytics)- Hybrid
Established in 2013 and now based in Blackrock, the Dublin Technology Centre delivers best in industry infrastructure and security services across the Zurich Insurance Group. Whether it's with one of our core capabilities such as Cyber Security, or working with our Cloud or Crowdsourcing teams, our customers are our priority. We work hard to deliver our services excellently with our unique talent. We are committed to working with the best and brightest people from the broadest talent pool possible. We believe a diversity of ideas fosters innovation and engagement, allows us to attract the best people, and to develop the best products, services and solutions. Qualified individuals from all walks of life are encouraged to apply.
They are currently recruiting for a Cloud Engineer ( Data Analytics).
The role of Cloud Engineer operates within the Cloud Engagement Office (CEO) team in our Cloud Centre of Excellence (CCoE). The CCoE is a cross-functional team responsible for developing and managing the cloud strategy, governance, and best practices that the rest of the organization can leverage to transform the business using the cloud. This role has a particular emphasis on providing Data Analytics support to our Cloud products. Key focus areas will include data driven reporting, dashboards and recognising value of Cloud products to our customers. This is not a coding role, although there are opportunities to utilise coding skills as required.
The CEO is recognised as the conduit for internal customers of Zurich’s multi-cloud platform to accelerate cloud adoption across the business and manage the roadmap for cloud migrations. The CEO product portfolio spans Cloud Advisory, FinOps, Risk & Compliance and Cloud Education. The Cloud Engineer (Data Analytics) role would appeal to a person who enjoys variety and developing opportunities within an evolving global function.

Job_title: Software Engineer - Foundations | Data Platform - Remote...
Description:
Would you like to help to create the future of a product used by thousands of businesses and millions of consumers? Phorest powers over 9,500 hair and beauty salons using our software in the UK, Ireland, Germany, Finland, the USA and Canada.
Our system touches every point of the salon experience. We have the in-salon software desktop application, Phorest Go (the native staff application), online bookings website for salons, and custom native apps per salon. In a typical month, Phorest processes 3 million appointments and we send over 3 million SMS and 4 million emails. We process 200k online bookings per month and over 150 custom built white label native apps.
The Opportunity
The Data Platform team at Phorest is responsible for providing simple, reliable, fast, and secure access to the data that powers our business. We manage the data stores, pipelines, and processes that contain and govern data at Phorest, and we make ourselves as accessible as possible to ensure that anyone in the company who needs data to do their jobs can get it.

Description:
Day in the life of an Engineering Manager

The Software Engineering Manager - eMaint is responsible for building excellent cross-functional software engineering teams to support the development and delivery of the industry-leading SaaS eMaint CMMS solution. On a typical day, the individual will split their time between guiding technical decision-making on product design, consulting, and coaching on industry best practices for the delivery of enterprise SaaS software, and engaging in 1-1 mentoring and development with their team members.

While they are technically credible and know the details of what engineers work on, they own the delivery of their product’s commitments and actively support performance improvements and career growth opportunities for their direct reports. They adapt departmental plans and priorities to meet short-term goals and operational challenges. This individual will report directly to the Senior Engineering Manager.

Responsibilities

Fostering a performance culture based on empowerment and ownership.
Driving employee engagement and sustaining a culture of continuous improvement
Coaching employees through obstacles and challenges with an ethos of empowerment
Through defining and observing KPIs and metrics, owns improvement initiatives related to quality, performance, and engagement.
Executing continuous data-driven improvement processes to improve quality, time to market, and delivery on quality attributes.
Actively influence product and technology roadmaps by leveraging technical proposals and quantifying technical debt.
Partnering with peers, Software Architects, and Product Owners to deliver resilient, scalable, connected SaaS solutions.
Through prioritization, planning, risk assessment, and analysis of dependencies and capacity enable meeting product milestones.
Facilitating communication, collaboration, and problem-solving with teams and stakeholders.

Your Team

Product development within Fluke Reliability is an internationally distributed and diverse organization. We embrace a culture of innovation, continuous improvement, and individual empowerment to provide an environment where individuals can grow and thrive.

We emphasize the importance of an inclusive culture welcoming diverse opinions that challenge the status quo. Required

At least three years of experience as an engineering manager;
As three years of experience developing and delivering commercially successful SaaS solutions;
At least three years of experience developing software using Agile methodologies;
Demonstrable understanding of product market fit for a product for which you have been the engineering leader.

Desired

Use of Scaled Agile frameworks.
Experience working with and leading a multi-national development team.

Personal Skills

Excellent problem-solving and collaboration skills;
Outstanding written, verbal, technical, and interpersonal communication skills;
Passion for continuous learning / continuous improvement;
Passion for the development and improvement of people.

Why you should join Fluke;

A company culture focused on developing employees and helping everyone reach their potential.
Competitive salary and benefits.
Fortive is a diversified industrial growth company comprised of global businesses that are recognized leaders in attractive markets. With more than $6 billion in annual revenues, Fortive’s well-known brands hold leading positions in field instrumentation, transportation, sensing, product realization, automation and specialty, and franchise distribution.

Fortive is headquartered in Everett, Washington and employs a team of more than 24,000 research and development, manufacturing, sales, distribution, service and administrative employees in more than 40 countries around the world. Our team grows by tackling challenges that accelerate progress and further their careers. With a culture rooted in continuous improvement, the core of our company’s operating model is the Fortive Business System. For more information please visit: www.fortive.com .

Fluke Corporation is the world leader in the manufacture, distribution and service of electronic test tools and software. We are a dynamic market leader with sound financial health. Fluke has achieved the number one or number two position in every market in which it competes. The Fluke brand has a reputation for portability, ruggedness, safety, ease of use and rigid standards of quality. A wholly owned subsidiary of Fortive Corporation ( www.fortive.com ), Fluke is a multi-national corporation headquartered in the greater Seattle area. We offer an entrepreneurial environment that is team-centered, customer-driven, quality-focused, and growth-oriented. It is driven by the phenomenally successful Fortive Business System. Working at Fluke gives you access to a robust career development process and challenging, “stretch” opportunities

Description:
Good understanding of resilience engineering and operational best practices
Proficient in any of Python, Java, Kotlin, Go, Rust, Ruby, C/C++.
Proficient with Linux, or other Unix operating systems.
Deep understanding of data structures, algorithms and their performance.
Experience with REST, web services and cloud environments.
Good practical knowledge of TCP/IP; you must be able to take a packet capture, read the flow and debug complex issues.

Are you ready to create systems to power one of the largest e-commerce companies in the world? Amazon.com has over 70 million customers, and developers all over the world rely on our storage, compute, and virtualised services via Amazon Web Services. We support systems at massive, and ever-growing, scale. We rapidly integrate new technologies to expand our customer offerings. Our success depends on our world-class network infrastructure and our goal is to become “The Infrastructure Platform” for the world. The AWS DNS team is seeking enthusiastic and talented Software Development Engineers to architect, build and operate large-scale DNS platforms, configuration management systems and real-time system status APIs. Our team relentlessly focuses on the security, performance, availability and scalability of our Internet-scale services. We build and operate systems that are critical in powering the platforms that Amazon's global retail, AWS and Kindle businesses run upon. As a member of our team, you will design and develop highly visible products, be involved in all aspects of the software development lifecycle and interact with many other engineering teams across Amazon. Successful candidates for this role will have strong analytical and troubleshooting and a desire to tackle the complex problems at scale. Key job responsibilities Automate the process we use for building our service in new AWS Regions. Improve Reliability Engineering in our DNS software and Systems. A day in the life You will participate in a team of engineers working to automate the process which we use to launch our service in new AWS Regions. The work will vary from engineering pipelines and Infrastructure-as-Code to taking Standard Operating Procedures and converting them to software. You will be reviewing code from others and authoring code, raising the bar with every change you make. About the team We are a team of System and Software Development engineers, passionate about highly-available distributed systems. Our service is critical to AWS and Amazon Retail and it is an "enabler" for other AWS Service Teams. We strive to relentlessly automate and are proud of our high operational standards. We are serious about career progression and have a demonstrable track record of growing and promoting engineers. We take life-work balance seriously and always prioritise work to make our engineer experience as good as possible.

Description:
Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a
culture of inclusion
for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Job Title
Data engineer II
Overview

Are you an experienced data engineer with a passion for technological innovation, have a can-do attitude and strong sense of ownership? The Small and Medium Enterprise (SME) platform is the perfect opportunity for you to assist in the design & development of a world-class unified platform, enabling Small and Medium Enterprises globally.

The SME team is looking for a Data Engineer II to work on the development of data pipelines to create a SME data mart on prem and on cloud. You will also work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, data analysts, and software engineers, to drive data-driven decision making throughout the organization.

Role

Implement data engineering pipelines that extract data from various sources, perform transformation, aggregations and load data into centralized storage system.

Work closely with senior data engineers and data architects using Agile methodology, take ownership of the delegated tasks and deliver the results in timely manner.

Support data scientists, data analysts in assessing, analyzing, and visualizing data, ensuring that data is accurate, reliable, and traceable.

Assist in troubleshooting and resolving issues with data pipelines and integrations, ensuring they are running smoothly and efficiently.

Maintain technical documentation for data pipelines, troubleshooting logs and data processing systems.

Support the design and implementation of data models, algorithms and feature stores that serve BI reporting and machine learning models.

Stay up to date with emerging technologies and trends in the data engineering space and willingness to learn and use new tools and platforms that can improve efficiency.

All About You

Demonstrated ability to implement data pipelines in large-scale data systems and distributed computing framework.

Hands-on experience with SQL and SPARK.

Knowledge of big data tools / technologies. (Hadoop, NIFI, Kafka, Impala, HIVE, OOZIE, Airflow etc.)

Knowledge of cloud-based data storage and processing systems. (Azure, AWS, GCP, databricks etc)

Knowledge of data modelling (SQL and NoSQL), data ETL and data warehousing concepts.

Good communication skills, with the ability to work in a team and collaborate with other data professionals and business stakeholders.

Strong attention to details and the ability to work under tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

Working experience of using common programming languages. (Python preferred)

BSc or higher degree in computer science or relevant fields.

Nice to have:

Databricks certifications

AWS Big Data, Data Analytics certification and / or Azure Data Engineer certification

BI dashboard reporting experiences.

Machine learning modelling experiences.

Description:
AnDAPT is fabless power semiconductor company revolutionizing power management through software-defined solutions offering unprecedented programmability to create and customize a power management IC (PMIC) within minutes. These solutions shorten time-to-market and afford flexibility for rapid changes keeping pace with user-defined requirements.
Summary
As an applications engineer, you need a mix of electronics and business knowledge to create meaningful impact. Key skills will include working both independently within the applications team and partnering with marketing to help the success of the company. You will need to be flexible because there is no typical workday.
You will support both pre- and post-sales interactions with engineers and business managers alike in making strategic and product development decisions. You will also be involved in creating and cultivating strategic partnerships between AnDAPT and other companies. This position will allow you to both use and develop both technical and business skills.

Protential Resources are recruiting an Electrical Design Engineer on behalf of their client, who, manufacture LV Switchgear and Motor Control Centres. They also manufacture and supply Prefabricated Data Centre Modules for Power, IT and Cooling.
Our client recognise that their workforce, are their greatest asset. They are a highly trained and dedicated to providing quality products and service for their clients.
The Role
This is a pivotal position in the design and manufacturing process, you will liaise with clients to ascertain and understand their specific design and technical needs.
You will also liaise with and advise your in-house design and estimating teams in order to customise products and design, to meet with client needs.

You'll build scalable, high performance, back-end cloud API services mostly using Go to help our clients attract, engage, hire, and advance top talent. Leveraging your basic knowledge, we'll support your expertise with Golang training! We are iCIMS Talent Cloud AI, an agile team of product people, data scientists and software engineers, who created a collaborative environment centered around passion for people and their careers, as well as data science, high-performance software, and user experiences. Our culture feeds from innovation, engineering excellence and owning the outcomes for our stakeholders. Even if you do not yet have direct experience with data science but are genuinely interested in AI, machine learning engineering, and Go, this could be the right role for you. If you have more experience, please apply as we may have some flexibility.

Description:
Summary
This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and Web Services at scale. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.
Canonical's Store team develops and operates the backend services that power the Snap Store and Charmhub.io marketplaces. Our services are built primarily in Python, within a bit of Golang. If you have a passion for clean APIs, have a bias towards shipping and believe that tests are the key to higher velocity and reliability, you'll fit right in.
We have some exciting challenges ahead including continuing to scale our production architecture, expand the store backend to handle additional package types, and enhance our on-prem offering for IoT and Enterprise solutions.

Guidewire’s Cloud Operations Team is part of the Product Development & Operations (PDO) organization, delivering 24x7 service to customers who are using Guidewire’s software products on the Guidewire Cloud Platform.

As a Cloud Operations Engineer (AWS), you will be part of a team that is passionately trying to automate everything possible to make Guidewire systems run more efficiently. The CloudOps Team is dedicated full-time to crafting and running software that improves the reliability of systems in production, serving hundreds of customers and supporting millions of transactions every single day. Job_title: Data Warehouse Engineer - €55 - 70k - Part Remote - Ireland Based
Description:
Data Warehouse Engineer
Posting End Date
31-Dec-2022
JOB DETAIL
Job Overview
This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced Data Warehouse Developer to join our expanding IT team responsible for the development and maintenance of our mission critical applications.
The successful candidate will be a key member of the DWH Development Team and should be passionate about Data Warehousing, have experience through all aspects of the Standard Development Life Cycle and keeps abreast of emerging trends in the DW/BI domain. The role requires the development of data warehouses ETL processes and data marts, both on premise and public cloud. The role also requires interaction with stakeholders and management to deliver strategic solutions and ensure any new solutions can be tactically reconciled against legacy reports.

AWS Cloud Platform Engineer
Millennium has a state of the art multi-cloud compute and data platform. The platform enables internal teams to take advantage of cloud native capabilities, iterate quickly, and build elastic solutions while ensuring security and resiliency.
As an AWS focused member of the Public Cloud Engineering team you will be responsible for a large multi-account AWS platform that enables many application development teams to host capabilities in AWS. You may be designing, building and supporting core platform capabilities such as global network connectivity, CI/CD shared infrastructure, or features of a global security and infrastructure orchestration platform. You will also be working with development teams across the firm to help customers build best practice, secure and cost effective solutions on AWS.
This is a hands-on developer role and candidates must have experience deploying and supporting their own production ready code in AWS as well as automating the build and management of a broad range of cloud infrastructure in AWS, preferably in Python. Candidates should be familiar with developing unit and functional tests, have experience designing and implementing CI/CD tools with infrastructure as code pipelines, have knowledge of Linux systems administration, containerization, networking, security, automated configuration and state management, cross system orchestration, configuration management, logging, metrics, monitoring, and alerting.

Description:
Job Requisition ID #
23WD68601
The Security Team @ Autodesk helps Autodesk design, build, deploy and maintain secure products. We are embedding security in the full spectrum of how we build our products from inception, design, development, testing to how we are running them in the cloud as well as how we are responding to any existing or emerging threats to our products or the building blocks of our products and services. Our job is to be one step ahead of the bad guys and use expertise, technology, and other resources to thwart their efforts to compromise our products and the environment in which they operate. Our team keeps a single-minded focus on protecting our customer’s data and their investment in our products by strengthening our applications, underlying services, and network.
Position Overview
Our Security Observability framework provides centralized visibility across Autodesk that enables us to better secure our Infrastructure and data. We are looking for an experienced Detection Engineer who can design, build, develop, engineer and mature our Security Observability/Logging framework and data engineering pipelines supporting Security Logging use cases. Your work will enable our threat hunting and intel, SIRT and compliance teams to defend against threats targeting Autodesk and to build customer trust.

Description:
Your work days are brighter here.
At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.
About the Team
The OMS Query team's mission is to provide scalable and highly performant data services for analytics and reporting from fast queries to big data insights. We are a core part of the Workday stack, working with concurrent and distributed systems to provide a scalable service for our internal and external customers.

Description:
Our mission is to connect and optimize the world's commerce. That means the whole world. So we're determined to nurture our culture of meritocracy where everyone can thrive, no matter what we look like, where we're from, how we grew up, whom we love, the nature of our faith, or how our bodies or minds work. We're committed to achieving equity in treatment and opportunity for everyone, where people are judged on the merits and quality of their work.
It all starts with people. Inside every company, behind every brand - while business success is often measured in profit, it has always been powered by people. We firmly believe people are the heart of any organization - including our own. That's why a career here provides much more than simple pay and perks. We're dedicated to empowering people, solving tough problems, and helping careers flourish inside and out.

Description:
Overview:
The successful candidate will have responsibility for one of our clients test facilities and over time this will rotate between each facility so as to become familiar with all. This includes responsibility for testing; data acquisition, processing, analysis and reporting of results; correct identification and timely reporting of problems; working as part of the wider engineering team the to resolve issues.

The ideal candidate will have the ability to identify and continuously drive improvement opportunities in test facility, process and product. A key focus of this position will be the development of automated data processing and analysis tools, programming these tools to test, generate and assess results and extract key performance data.
Qualifications:
A Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics or Science (or similar).

Description:
When you join KPMG Ireland, you are joining a community of over 4,200 employees who collectively work together, both in person and virtually, to achieve their full potential.

We are known as an organisation who want you to come as you are and do work that truly matters. Joining KPMG Ireland is an opportunity to enhance your career, not only in the work that you enjoy doing, but equally through the global connections that you make, the lifelong learning that you can accomplish and the chance to make your mark.

Are you our next Data Engineer Consultant?

Location: Dublin, as part of our hybrid working model.

Grade: Senior Consultant

Permanent





Building a pioneering innovation and delivery team in the data, analytics and AI space is a strategic objective of KPMG Ireland. You can expect support from the highest leadership in the company to grow and develop your skills to help lead the markets. You will be hands on, working across functions and industries, continuously learning, and building your skills.

You will be expected to be consulted and participate in solving client issues. Mentoring is expected, teach what you know and learn from others. You will contribute to building and maintaining high morale in the team, where you can be trusted and trust your teammates.



You will join the KPMG Applied Intelligence team, composed of 60 professional's specialists in data, analytics and Artificial Intelligence dedicated to harnessing the power of data in all its forms and using new technologies to solve data problems and deliver a step change in client performance. We ensure that our clients are using their data to maximum benefit by breaking down previously unconnected silos of data and enabling the launch of next-generation business analytics, creating insights that have led to our clients' increased profitability, deepening customer relationships and better-managing costs and risks.



All of our employees are given a benefits package which they can tailor to suit their individual preferences. Our range of benefits include:





When you join KPMG, your performance manager will support you to ensure that you are enhancing your skills from day one. You will also receive continuous support from our award-winning Business School where you will be continuously encouraged to deepen your knowledge and expertise within your chosen career path.

In addition to this, we are the only one of the Big Four firms to announce promotions four times per year, giving you frequent opportunities for progression throughout your career with us.



At KPMG, we want to attract and retain the best talent. We recognise the strength that comes from having a diverse workforce and building a culture where we support all our people to achieve their potential. Visit https://home.kpmg/ie/en/home/careers/graduate/inclusion-diversity.html to learn more.



If you are interested in the above role, please submit a CV via the apply button. If you have any specific queries on the role, please contact Nicole Wilson.

For an interactive insight into life at KPMG, make sure to follow #KPMGLife on social media You can find us on LinkedIn, Instagram, TikTok and Twitter.

#LI-NW



By clicking apply to this role your application will not only be considered for this position, but your details will be stored on our database and may be considered for similar future positions that may arise. This means that the personal data contained in your application and provided to KPMG as part of the application process may be retained by us for up to 18 months from the date of your application and you hereby agree to that. If you do not wish your details to be stored on our recruitment database, please email careers@kpmg.ie stating this and we will ensure that such information is not stored other than for the purposes of this application.

Description:
Guidewire’s Cloud Operations Team is part of the Product Development & Operations (PDO) organization, delivering 24x7 service to customers who are using Guidewire’s software products on the Guidewire Cloud Platform.

The Role:

As a Cloud Operations Engineer (AWS), you will be part of a team that is passionately trying to automate everything possible to make Guidewire systems run more efficiently. The CloudOps Team is dedicated full-time to crafting and running software that improves the reliability of systems in production, serving hundreds of customers and supporting millions of transactions every single day. You will be operating Guidewire’s flagship cloud platform and InsuranceSuite products and building tooling to help ensure efficient operations and optimal availability of all SaaS multi-tenant and customer-focused systems. Cloud Engineers collaborate closely with Guidewire’s product developers to ensure that the Guidewire core cloud products address functional and non-functional requirements such as availability, performance, observability, and maintainability.

Description:
Summary
This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and Web Services at scale. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.
Canonical's Store team develops and operates the backend services that power the Snap Store and Charmhub.io marketplaces. Our services are built primarily in Python, within a bit of Golang. If you have a passion for clean APIs, have a bias towards shipping and believe that tests are the key to higher velocity and reliability, you'll fit right in.
We have some exciting challenges ahead including continuing to scale our production architecture, expand the store backend to handle additional package types, and enhance our on-prem offering for IoT and Enterprise solutions.

Description:
AWS Cloud Platform Engineer
Millennium has a state of the art multi-cloud compute and data platform. The platform enables internal teams to take advantage of cloud native capabilities, iterate quickly, and build elastic solutions while ensuring security and resiliency.
As an AWS focused member of the Public Cloud Engineering team you will be responsible for a large multi-account AWS platform that enables many application development teams to host capabilities in AWS. You may be designing, building and supporting core platform capabilities such as global network connectivity, CI/CD shared infrastructure, or features of a global security and infrastructure orchestration platform. You will also be working with development teams across the firm to help customers build best practice, secure and cost effective solutions on AWS.
This is a hands-on developer role and candidates must have experience deploying and supporting their own production ready code in AWS as well as automating the build and management of a broad range of cloud infrastructure in AWS, preferably in Python. Candidates should be familiar with developing unit and functional tests, have experience designing and implementing CI/CD tools with infrastructure as code pipelines, have knowledge of Linux systems administration, containerization, networking, security, automated configuration and state management, cross system orchestration, configuration management, logging, metrics, monitoring, and alerting.

Description:
Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) designs and manufactures semiconductor products and solutions. We enable our customers to interpret the world around us by intelligently bridging the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that sense, measure and connect.
Design, develop, qualify and implement automated final test processing solutions for integrated circuits. Work with device test engineers and vendors of automated processing equipment to develop test equipment and hardware solutions that meet internal test requirements and specifications. Define process technology roadmaps which match ADI product line needs with available processes at subcontractors across Southeast Asia. As necessary, qualify new processes at those test subcontractors. Coordinate process development efforts with team of process engineers based in Philippines. Identify and implement improvements to existing test automation solutions as needed. Support new process release and control systems. Work with ADI process strategy teams to ensure consistent test standards implementation across all ADI sites. Position is located in Limerick but will be in support of ADI product development locations in other ADI Test Development sites.
Job Req Type: Experienced
Required Travel: Yes, 10% of the time
Shift Type: 1st Shift/Days
