Description:
JWR Employment Specialists are delighted to be working with a growing international manufacturing company located in Castlebar, Co. Mayo to recruit a Quality Engineer.
This is a critical quality position associated with the operation of our manufacturing facility located in Castlebar, Ireland. The role will be responsible for supporting the Quality Department in the implementation of all aspects of the QMS, while also engaging with their counterparts in Camarillo to ensure the transfer of best practices between the two sites. The Quality Engineer will report locally to the Senior Quality Engineer.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
General:

We are a growing medical device company, based in Galway, and dedicated to reducing the burden of diabetic foot ulcers to patients and healthcare systems. We sit at the overlap of the high growth areas of medical device and connected health, and have developed a novel thermovisual foot scanner and remote monitoring system to detect issues early and prevent ulcer development. In 2021 the European Union recognised the scale of the problem and the novelty of the companies solution, and announced a significant investment to fund commercialisation of the technology and growth of the company.

Principal R&D Engineer Role and Responsibilities We have developed a cutting-edge foot scanner device that which enables combined thermal and visual imaging of the sole of the human foot in a low-profile home-use product. The scans from the device are sent to the cloud for remote monitoring. The first-generation product will enter clinical trials in the coming months. We are seeking a high calibre candidate to join our strong cross functional engineering team.

You will report to the Director of Product Development. You will have involvement at all phases in the product development process, from concept generation through to commercialisation and manufacturing. This role will involve collaboration with various departments, team members, and suppliers.

Description:
R&D Engineer II Due to continued expansion of our operations, we are seeking applications from a suitably qualified and experienced R&D Engineer II (Permanent). Our Research and Development team has invented breakthroughs that have improved millions of lives worldwide. Creativity, curiosity and a deep caring for human life are fundamental to our culture. That passion for innovation shows-Forbes lists us as one of the 100 most innovative companies in the world. Join us, and you'll be part of our mission to push the boundaries of science, right from the start. With access to some of the most exciting global technologies, you'll find the work here challenging and rewarding. What's more, you'll be in an environment where your colleagues will truly listen to your big ideas and turn them into results. We are seeking a highly motivated R&D Engineer to join the Galway Structural Heart R&D team.
Be a part of one of the company's most exciting areas of growth. The successful candidate will join a dynamic team in developing products, materials, processes, tests or equipment for medical device products in the treatment of heart disease. This candidate will participate in an interdisciplinary team of engineers working on transcatheter heart valve devices from project concept, through product development and post commercialisation.

Your Contribution:
Procad Engineering shares a passion for lifelong learning. By joining us, you will receive comprehensive and structured professional training and development support, a collaborative environment and exposure to all aspects of delivering leading industrial facilities. Since our opening in 1995, we have grown into a significant multidisciplinary engineering firm delivering substantial projects for Food & Beverage, Pharmaceutical, Medical Device, and Semiconductor manufacturing clients in Ireland and abroad.

Description:
JWR Employment Specialists are delighted to be working with a growing international manufacturing company located in Castlebar, Co. Mayo to recruit a Quality Engineer.
This is a critical quality position associated with the operation of our manufacturing facility located in Castlebar, Ireland. The role will be responsible for supporting the Quality Department in the implementation of all aspects of the QMS, while also engaging with their counterparts in Camarillo to ensure the transfer of best practices between the two sites. The Quality Engineer will report locally to the Senior Quality Engineer.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
General:

We are a growing medical device company, based in Galway, and dedicated to reducing the burden of diabetic foot ulcers to patients and healthcare systems. We sit at the overlap of the high growth areas of medical device and connected health, and have developed a novel thermovisual foot scanner and remote monitoring system to detect issues early and prevent ulcer development. In 2021 the European Union recognised the scale of the problem and the novelty of the companies solution, and announced a significant investment to fund commercialisation of the technology and growth of the company.

Principal R&D Engineer Role and Responsibilities We have developed a cutting-edge foot scanner device that which enables combined thermal and visual imaging of the sole of the human foot in a low-profile home-use product. The scans from the device are sent to the cloud for remote monitoring. The first-generation product will enter clinical trials in the coming months. We are seeking a high calibre candidate to join our strong cross functional engineering team.

You will report to the Director of Product Development. You will have involvement at all phases in the product development process, from concept generation through to commercialisation and manufacturing. This role will involve collaboration with various departments, team members, and suppliers.

Description:
Job Description


REQ ID: 105321
JOB TITLE: Senior Systems Engineer
SALARY: Competitive
LOCATION: Shannon, Ireland

Dreaming for tomorrow is about more than ideas and ambitions. We're already building the next generation of vehicles, using repurposed and brand-new technology and techniques. We're doing more than dream, we're creating the future of mobility and automotive for years to come.



An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Senior Systems Engineer here at Jaguar Land Rover Ireland. We are looking for someone with previous experience to undertake this new role and make a difference. If you are passionate and driven this could be the perfect fit for you and a great chance to work with one of the most prestigious automotive brands in the world.

Expect to be operating within a multi-disciplinary product team, the team is responsible for creating and developing new (and improving existing) location service products. It is crucial for the successful candidate to have strong collaboration skills and have an innovative mindset.

Empowered to lead technical aspects of the engineering tasks, to support the Product Owner in identifying creative ways to maximize the delivery of the product roadmap and backlog, whilst recognizing dependencies, gaps and risks.

The role requires a strong system level understanding of the functionality and use cases of Vehicle Positioning, Electronic Horizon and Map Data across in-vehicle applications. Deploying and delivering innovative service solutions to enhance vehicle performance and driver experiences for our most discerning of customers.



You will need to be proficient working within a multi-disciplinary product team to define the system design and requirements for vehicle positioning and electronic horizon services. It is imperative that you are empowered to make technical decisions in order to solve problems aligned to a defined product vision, mission, and goals.

As this is a role that needs a strong level of communication you must be proficient in facilitating stakeholder collaboration as requested in order to put the customer needs first. You will be required to maintain technical knowledge through research and supplier engagement in order to collaborate on the strategic approach of the product and be able to develop this further.

Knowledge, skills and experience

Essential:








Desirable:







Bring all this to the home of premium innovation, and you'll find the opportunities to further your career with a world-class team, a discounted car purchase and lease scheme for you and your family, membership of a competitive pension plan and private medical cover. All this and more makes Jaguar Land Rover the perfect place to continue your journey.

Jaguar Land Rover is committed to equal opportunity for all.

Solutions Engineering Manager
Our client is a fast-growing, ambitious, highly successful and multi award-winning software security company. They are seeking a Solution Engineering Manager to join their team in Galway.
The Role:
The primary purpose of this role is to lead a team of Solution Engineers and facilitate seamless onboarding and demonstrations of our products for partners. This role serves as an internal and customer facing representative of our engineering and sales orgs that are responsible for the technical onboarding of both internal new hires and external partners to our platforms. A firm understanding of the sales lifecycle as well as troubleshooting client needs is therefore required. In addition to leading a team responsible for technical onboarding and demonstrations, this role is also responsible for creating and maintaining written documentation. Such documentation includes overviews, guides, and tutorials for use by a variety of audience types.

We have an exciting role for you - join us as a Google Cloud Architect.


TCS is a purpose-led transformation company, built on belief. We don’t just help businesses to transform through technology. We support them in making a meaningful difference to the people and communities they serve - our clients include some of the biggest brands in Ireland and worldwide. As , you will be at the centre of GCP Cloud Armour WAF / Network Security Engineer focusing on GCP Firewall Risk Governance, GCP VPC Service Control Review, Technical Architecture Reviews of Network Components, and Risk-Assessing Network Interfaces and Network Zoning Diagrams.







TCS is consistently voted a Top Employer in the UK&I and globally. Our competitive salary packages feature pension, health care, life assurance, laptop, phone, access to extensive training resources and discounts within the larger Tata network.





At TCS, we believe in building and sustaining a culture of equity and belonging where everyone can thrive. Our diversity motto is ‘Inclusion without Exception’.

We encourage applications from all sections of society. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, sex, pregnancy and maternity, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

TCS is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to its employees and applicants for employment to ensure that individuals with disabilities enjoy equal access to all employment opportunities. Description:
Job Description


REQ ID: 105321
JOB TITLE: Senior Systems Engineer
SALARY: Competitive
LOCATION: Shannon, Ireland

Dreaming for tomorrow is about more than ideas and ambitions. We're already building the next generation of vehicles, using repurposed and brand-new technology and techniques. We're doing more than dream, we're creating the future of mobility and automotive for years to come.



An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Senior Systems Engineer here at Jaguar Land Rover Ireland. We are looking for someone with previous experience to undertake this new role and make a difference. If you are passionate and driven this could be the perfect fit for you and a great chance to work with one of the most prestigious automotive brands in the world.

Expect to be operating within a multi-disciplinary product team, the team is responsible for creating and developing new (and improving existing) location service products. It is crucial for the successful candidate to have strong collaboration skills and have an innovative mindset.

Empowered to lead technical aspects of the engineering tasks, to support the Product Owner in identifying creative ways to maximize the delivery of the product roadmap and backlog, whilst recognizing dependencies, gaps and risks.

The role requires a strong system level understanding of the functionality and use cases of Vehicle Positioning, Electronic Horizon and Map Data across in-vehicle applications. Deploying and delivering innovative service solutions to enhance vehicle performance and driver experiences for our most discerning of customers.



You will need to be proficient working within a multi-disciplinary product team to define the system design and requirements for vehicle positioning and electronic horizon services. It is imperative that you are empowered to make technical decisions in order to solve problems aligned to a defined product vision, mission, and goals.

As this is a role that needs a strong level of communication you must be proficient in facilitating stakeholder collaboration as requested in order to put the customer needs first. You will be required to maintain technical knowledge through research and supplier engagement in order to collaborate on the strategic approach of the product and be able to develop this further.

Knowledge, skills and experience

Desirable:

Description:
Your Contribution:
Procad Engineering shares a passion for lifelong learning. By joining us, you will receive comprehensive and structured professional training and development support, a collaborative environment and exposure to all aspects of delivering leading industrial facilities. Since our opening in 1995, we have grown into a significant multidisciplinary engineering firm delivering substantial projects for Food & Beverage, Pharmaceutical, Medical Device, and Semiconductor manufacturing clients in Ireland and abroad.
People are our greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package, leading work-life balance and flexibility. We are ready to accommodate flexible, part-time and hybrid working conditions suitable to you and our organisation.
You will become an essential part of the team, assisting the delivery of industrial facilities with your mechanical design and project management experience. We offer a dynamic and rewarding career as part of the industry-leading and recognised multidisciplinary consultancy working on challenging and exciting projects for some of the biggest names in Ireland.

REQ ID: 113781
JOB TITLE: Senior Software Engineer
SALARY: Competitive
LOCATION: Shannon, Ireland

Dreaming for tomorrow is about more than ideas and ambitions. We're already building the next generation of vehicles, using repurposed and brand-new technology and techniques. We're doing more than dream, we're creating the future of mobility and automotive for years to come.



The main purpose of this role is to support the complete life cycle of new/modified software product, from research and design to implementation, training and support in the cloud.

You will work with lead engineers to write and modify programmes; testing code; diagnosing faults in software; and designing programmes to solve those faults. All these tasks typically involve a detailed and meticulous problem-solving process. To work within an Agile and Scrum manner to focus on incremental delivery of platform components and capabilities, with early feedback input required from both colleagues and stakeholders.



A strong working knowledge of JavaScript/Java/C++ is essential for this position. You will have proficiency in object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, problem solving and complexity analysis. Fundamentally, it is imperative you have working knowledge of software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.

Essential:

All this and more makes Jaguar Land Rover the perfect place to continue your journey.

Jaguar Land Rover is committed to equal opportunity for all.

Description:
Job Description


REQ ID: 105321
JOB TITLE: Senior Systems Engineer
SALARY: Competitive
LOCATION: Shannon, Ireland

Dreaming for tomorrow is about more than ideas and ambitions. We're already building the next generation of vehicles, using repurposed and brand-new technology and techniques. We're doing more than dream, we're creating the future of mobility and automotive for years to come.



An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Senior Systems Engineer here at Jaguar Land Rover Ireland. We are looking for someone with previous experience to undertake this new role and make a difference. If you are passionate and driven this could be the perfect fit for you and a great chance to work with one of the most prestigious automotive brands in the world.

Expect to be operating within a multi-disciplinary product team, the team is responsible for creating and developing new (and improving existing) location service products. It is crucial for the successful candidate to have strong collaboration skills and have an innovative mindset.

Empowered to lead technical aspects of the engineering tasks, to support the Product Owner in identifying creative ways to maximize the delivery of the product roadmap and backlog, whilst recognizing dependencies, gaps and risks.

The role requires a strong system level understanding of the functionality and use cases of Vehicle Positioning, Electronic Horizon and Map Data across in-vehicle applications. Deploying and delivering innovative service solutions to enhance vehicle performance and driver experiences for our most discerning of customers.



You will need to be proficient working within a multi-disciplinary product team to define the system design and requirements for vehicle positioning and electronic horizon services. It is imperative that you are empowered to make technical decisions in order to solve problems aligned to a defined product vision, mission, and goals.

As this is a role that needs a strong level of communication you must be proficient in facilitating stakeholder collaboration as requested in order to put the customer needs first. You will be required to maintain technical knowledge through research and supplier engagement in order to collaborate on the strategic approach of the product and be able to develop this further.

Knowledge, skills and experience

Essential:








Desirable:







Bring all this to the home of premium innovation, and you'll find the opportunities to further your career with a world-class team, a discounted car purchase and lease scheme for you and your family, membership of a competitive pension plan and private medical cover. All this and more makes Jaguar Land Rover the perfect place to continue your journey.

Jaguar Land Rover is committed to equal opportunity for all.

Description:
R&D Engineer II Due to continued expansion of our operations, we are seeking applications from a suitably qualified and experienced R&D Engineer II (Permanent). Our Research and Development team has invented breakthroughs that have improved millions of lives worldwide. Creativity, curiosity and a deep caring for human life are fundamental to our culture. That passion for innovation shows-Forbes lists us as one of the 100 most innovative companies in the world. Join us, and you'll be part of our mission to push the boundaries of science, right from the start. With access to some of the most exciting global technologies, you'll find the work here challenging and rewarding. What's more, you'll be in an environment where your colleagues will truly listen to your big ideas and turn them into results. We are seeking a highly motivated R&D Engineer to join the Galway Structural Heart R&D team.
Be a part of one of the company's most exciting areas of growth. The successful candidate will join a dynamic team in developing products, materials, processes, tests or equipment for medical device products in the treatment of heart disease. This candidate will participate in an interdisciplinary team of engineers working on transcatheter heart valve devices from project concept, through product development and post commercialisation.

Description:
Your Contribution:
Procad Engineering shares a passion for lifelong learning. By joining us, you will receive comprehensive and structured professional training and development support, a collaborative environment and exposure to all aspects of delivering leading industrial facilities. Since our opening in 1995, we have grown into a significant multidisciplinary engineering firm delivering substantial projects for Food & Beverage, Pharmaceutical, Medical Device, and Semiconductor manufacturing clients in Ireland and abroad.
People are our greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package, leading work-life balance and flexibility. We are ready to accommodate flexible, part-time and hybrid working conditions suitable to you and our organisation.
You will become an essential part of the team, assisting the delivery of industrial facilities with your mechanical design and project management experience. We offer a dynamic and rewarding career as part of the industry-leading and recognised multidisciplinary consultancy working on challenging and exciting projects for some of the biggest names in Ireland.

Junior Project Engineer

Location Galway

This company are a leader in the design and manufacture of specialty self-clinch fasteners and are committed to providing quality, value added products and services. The European Applications Engineering Department is responsible for the design, development and commercialization of innovative fastening solutions for European and global markets. These solutions often require dedicated project design and development across many manufacturing functions and departments. This fulltime position within our Applications Engineering Team requires a self-motivated individual that is capable of managing these plans that will meet project objectives while adhering to an agreed budget and timeline. His role involves overseeing all projects from start to finish. The Project engineer duties will include defining the project's scope, accessing the necessary resources to complete it, anticipating time and financial requirements, communicating to all stakeholders and controlling project documentation.


Generate project development, manufacturing, testing and validation costs related to a project. Setup and review project feasibility with senior management cross functional team for project Go/No-Go review.
Coordinate feedback to customer of PEM design proposal and feasibility review.




· Communicate with all business levels of support functions including management. · Travel and promote PEMs Application Engineering and product/project development offering, including new product releases to external customers.

Description:
Your Contribution:
Procad Engineering shares a passion for lifelong learning. By joining us, you will receive comprehensive and structured professional training and development support, a collaborative environment and exposure to all aspects of delivering leading industrial facilities. Since our opening in 1995, we have grown into a significant multidisciplinary engineering firm delivering substantial projects for Food & Beverage, Pharmaceutical, Medical Device, and Semiconductor manufacturing clients in Ireland and abroad.
People are our greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package, leading work-life balance and flexibility. We are ready to accommodate flexible, part-time and hybrid working conditions suitable to you and our organisation.
You will become an essential part of the team, assisting the delivery of industrial facilities with your mechanical design and project management experience. We offer a dynamic and rewarding career as part of the industry-leading and recognised multidisciplinary consultancy working on challenging and exciting projects for some of the biggest names in Ireland.

Description:
PEMSERTER In-Die Engineer
Location: Galway



The In-Die Engineer is a key member of the In-Die team whose main role involves:
· Design and development of In-Die tooling and systems · Support In-Die tooling installs and system commissions
In-Die office responsibilities including the creation and maintenance of documents and systems to ensure that our products are designed, manufactured & assembled to the correct standards and by the correct process
Communication - verbal and written, externally with customers & distributors and internally with sales, operations, engineering, quality, purchasing etc


Mechanical engineering aptitude
Electrical/electronic engineering aptitude
Technical drawing skills
Documentation control
Accuracy and conscientiousness are necessary for success in the role · Ability to work with minimal supervision - setting priorities & time management
Confident and competent communicator, verbal and written - with management, external sales, distributors, customers etc.
Confidence, ability and consent to travel throughout Europe - conceivably frequently and at short notice


Data sheet evaluation, preparation of costings/quotes, tool design, die review/feedback, managing the manufacture, assembly, testing, packaging & dispatch of In-Die systems and supporting tool installation and system commission.
Responsible for multiple projects at any one time
Create & modify drawings as necessary and maintain relevant documentation
Maintain the PEMSERTER® In-Die workshop/tooling preparation area to a high standard.
Stock management of PEMSERTER® In-Die parts, ensuring adequate stock levels are maintained to fulfil customer requirements
Add and maintain parts on JDE:
Bills of Materials
Routers
Product Masters


Generate Work Orders
Issue material
Assemble and validate tooling
Assign design, assembly and packaging hours to close out work order

Create & modify procedures & work instructions whilst maintaining documentation control

The above list is not exhaustive, the duties and responsibilities highlighted in this job description are indicative and may vary over time due to business demands. Employees are expected to undertake other duties and responsibilities relevant to the nature, level and scope of their role.

Autodesk Inventor, JDE, ECN Database, GQMS Database


Engineering qualification - discipline flexible
Mechanical Engineering aptitude
Electrical/electronic Engineering aptitude
Fluent in English language, both written and verbal (German could also be advantageous)
Familiar with CAD packages such Autodesk Inventor, ProE or other
Maths and organisational skills
Computer skills are required, particularly the ability to use spreadsheets and databases; ability to use presentations (MS PowerPoint) is also necessary
Experience in a press shop environment would be advantageous
Some travel, predominantly within Europe but potentially further afield, should be expected from this position. Candidate must be willing and able to travel, at short notice, as and when necessary

Description:
Job Description


REQ ID: 105041
JOB TITLE: Engineering Manager
SALARY: Competitive
LOCATION: Shannon, Ireland

Dreaming for tomorrow is about more than ideas and ambitions. We're already building the next generation of vehicles, using repurposed and brand-new technology and techniques. We're doing more than dream, we're creating the future of mobility and automotive for years to come.



This is an excellent opportunity for an enthusiastic and experienced Engineering Manager with a background in leadership and mentorship, who has a passion for employee development and stake holder satisfaction.

The main purpose of this role is to support the design and development of disruptive and innovative technologies. The team are the centre of gravity for testing excellence in JLR and this steam specifically develop bleeding edge solutions that have a direct impact on our vehicle range.

This platform is used in all facets of engineers, some of note are autonomous vehicles and advanced control systems, electric powertrains, to class-leading infotainment, cloud-connected features, and integration of consumer electronic technologies, not to mention the opportunity to drive & test advanced prototype vehicles.


































Internally: working within Product Engineering across multiple workgroups and cross-functional teams.

Cloud and Embedded Software Teams

Software Validation Team(s)

Product Owner(s)

Scrum Master(s)

Agile Coach(es)

: working with Academia and external partners to ensure our engineers are being enabled to maximise success in their careers.



Bring all this to the home of premium innovation, and you'll find the opportunities to further your career with a world-class team, a discounted car purchase and lease scheme for you and your family, membership of a competitive pension plan and private medical cover. All this and more makes Jaguar Land Rover the perfect place to continue your journey.

Jaguar Land Rover is committed to equal opportunity for all.

Description:
We are looking for a Production Engineer to join our team. The role will provide technical support for manufacturing operations at our Dublin site and for the introduction and successful start-up of new product lines and technologies. We are looking for a person with good technical knowledge, excellent problem solving skills and growth potential. This is a permanent full-time position, based at our new modern facility and reports to the Production Manager.
Company Overview
Joule is a multinational manufacturer and distributor of heating, ventilation, hot water and renewable energy solutions, operating in the Irish, UK and European markets. We have a number of manufacturing locations throughout Europe. In our state of the art facility in Dublin, we manufacture a wide range of products using innovative designs and utilizing the most up to date production methods

Post Title : Graduate Automation Engineer
Post Duration: Permanent Full Time

Premium Power is an Irish electrical engineering consultancy providing risk management solutions for high tech manufacturing, data centre, utility and renewable sectors. Description:
Job Description


REQ ID: 105321
JOB TITLE: Senior Systems Engineer
SALARY: Competitive
LOCATION: Shannon, Ireland

Dreaming for tomorrow is about more than ideas and ambitions. We're already building the next generation of vehicles, using repurposed and brand-new technology and techniques. We're doing more than dream, we're creating the future of mobility and automotive for years to come.



An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Senior Systems Engineer here at Jaguar Land Rover Ireland. We are looking for someone with previous experience to undertake this new role and make a difference. If you are passionate and driven this could be the perfect fit for you and a great chance to work with one of the most prestigious automotive brands in the world.

Expect to be operating within a multi-disciplinary product team, the team is responsible for creating and developing new (and improving existing) location service products. It is crucial for the successful candidate to have strong collaboration skills and have an innovative mindset.

Empowered to lead technical aspects of the engineering tasks, to support the Product Owner in identifying creative ways to maximize the delivery of the product roadmap and backlog, whilst recognizing dependencies, gaps and risks.

The role requires a strong system level understanding of the functionality and use cases of Vehicle Positioning, Electronic Horizon and Map Data across in-vehicle applications. Deploying and delivering innovative service solutions to enhance vehicle performance and driver experiences for our most discerning of customers.



You will need to be proficient working within a multi-disciplinary product team to define the system design and requirements for vehicle positioning and electronic horizon services. It is imperative that you are empowered to make technical decisions in order to solve problems aligned to a defined product vision, mission, and goals.

As this is a role that needs a strong level of communication you must be proficient in facilitating stakeholder collaboration as requested in order to put the customer needs first. You will be required to maintain technical knowledge through research and supplier engagement in order to collaborate on the strategic approach of the product and be able to develop this further.

Knowledge, skills and experience

Essential:








Desirable:







Bring all this to the home of premium innovation, and you'll find the opportunities to further your career with a world-class team, a discounted car purchase and lease scheme for you and your family, membership of a competitive pension plan and private medical cover. All this and more makes Jaguar Land Rover the perfect place to continue your journey.

Jaguar Land Rover is committed to equal opportunity for all.

Description:
Your Contribution:
Procad Engineering shares a passion for lifelong learning. By joining us, you will receive comprehensive and structured professional training and development support, a collaborative environment and exposure to all aspects of delivering leading industrial facilities. Since our opening in 1995, we have grown into a significant multidisciplinary engineering firm delivering substantial projects for Food & Beverage, Pharmaceutical, Medical Device, and Semiconductor manufacturing clients in Ireland and abroad.

Job Description

JOB TITLE: Senior Software Engineer
SALARY: Competitive
LOCATION: Shannon, Ireland

Dreaming for tomorrow is about more than ideas and ambitions. We're already building the next generation of vehicles, using repurposed and brand-new technology and techniques. We're doing more than dream, we're creating the future of mobility and automotive for years to come.



The main purpose of this role is to support the complete life cycle of new/modified software product, from research and design to implementation, training and support in the cloud.

You will work with lead engineers to write and modify programmes; testing code; diagnosing faults in software; and designing programmes to solve those faults. All these tasks typically involve a detailed and meticulous problem-solving process. To work within an Agile and Scrum manner to focus on incremental delivery of platform components and capabilities, with early feedback input required from both colleagues and stakeholders.



A strong working knowledge of JavaScript/Java/C++ is essential for this position. You will have proficiency in object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, problem solving and complexity analysis. Fundamentally, it is imperative you have working knowledge of software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.

Essential:

All this and more makes Jaguar Land Rover the perfect place to continue your journey.

Description:
Job Description


REQ ID: 104981
JOB TITLE: Senior AutoSAR Developer
SALARY: Competitive
LOCATION: Shannon, Ireland

Dreaming for tomorrow is about more than ideas and ambitions. We're already building the next generation of vehicles, using repurposed and brand-new technology and techniques. We're doing more than dream, we're creating the future of mobility and automotive for years to come.



This position is for a Senior Embedded Software Engineer within Jaguar Land Rovers Software Development team in Ireland, delivering the software platform for our next generation vehicle architecture. Software development will include the definition, configuration and integration of AUTOSAR Basic Software components - for classic frameworks. We offer a dynamic work environment, the chance to grow within the company and to develop your competences in new technologies. This is a great role where you will be working with a supportive team and on exciting new products and technologies including automotive Ethernet networks, multicore application hosting and SOTA.

This position is for a highly motivated and experienced automotive engineer with responsibility for the design, development and delivery of our next generation software platform in an Autosar framework. You will have a record of production software development and delivery through all stages of the engineering development V cycle regarding software artefacts, requirements cascade, design, implementation, validation, and verification in an AUTOSAR compliant framework. You will be involved in the support of Autosar communication software within existing architectures with clarification of requirements, configuration parameters and tooling support.

Working with a team of System, Architecture, Hardware, Software and Controls Engineers, you'll aim to deliver concept and production systems in a timely manner, according to vehicle programme timing and local delivery milestones, whilst overseeing issue investigation and ECU diagnosis.

Description:
R&D Engineer II Due to continued expansion of our operations, we are seeking applications from a suitably qualified and experienced R&D Engineer II (Permanent). Our Research and Development team has invented breakthroughs that have improved millions of lives worldwide. Creativity, curiosity and a deep caring for human life are fundamental to our culture. That passion for innovation shows-Forbes lists us as one of the 100 most innovative companies in the world. Join us, and you'll be part of our mission to push the boundaries of science, right from the start. With access to some of the most exciting global technologies, you'll find the work here challenging and rewarding. What's more, you'll be in an environment where your colleagues will truly listen to your big ideas and turn them into results. We are seeking a highly motivated R&D Engineer to join the Galway Structural Heart R&D team.
Be a part of one of the company's most exciting areas of growth. The successful candidate will join a dynamic team in developing products, materials, processes, tests or equipment for medical device products in the treatment of heart disease. This candidate will participate in an interdisciplinary team of engineers working on transcatheter heart valve devices from project concept, through product development and post commercialisation.

Description:
Your Contribution:
Procad Engineering shares a passion for lifelong learning. By joining us, you will receive comprehensive and structured professional training and development support, a collaborative environment and exposure to all aspects of delivering leading industrial facilities. Since our opening in 1995, we have grown into a significant multidisciplinary engineering firm delivering substantial projects for Food & Beverage, Pharmaceutical, Medical Device, and Semiconductor manufacturing clients in Ireland and abroad.
People are our greatest asset, and we offer a competitive package, leading work-life balance and flexibility. We are ready to accommodate flexible, part-time and hybrid working conditions suitable to you and our organisation.
You will become an essential part of the team, assisting the delivery of industrial facilities with your mechanical design and project management experience. We offer a dynamic and rewarding career as part of the industry-leading and recognised multidisciplinary consultancy working on challenging and exciting projects for some of the biggest names in Ireland.

We have an exciting role for you - join us as a Google Cloud Architect.

Job Description


REQ ID: 113781
JOB TITLE: Senior Software Engineer
SALARY: Competitive
LOCATION: Shannon, Ireland

Dreaming for tomorrow is about more than ideas and ambitions. We're already building the next generation of vehicles, using repurposed and brand-new technology and techniques. We're doing more than dream, we're creating the future of mobility and automotive for years to come.



The main purpose of this role is to support the complete life cycle of new/modified software product, from research and design to implementation, training and support in the cloud.

You will work with lead engineers to write and modify programmes; testing code; diagnosing faults in software; and designing programmes to solve those faults. All these tasks typically involve a detailed and meticulous problem-solving process. To work within an Agile and Scrum manner to focus on incremental delivery of platform components and capabilities, with early feedback input required from both colleagues and stakeholders.



A strong working knowledge of JavaScript/Java/C++ is essential for this position. You will have proficiency in object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, problem solving and complexity analysis. Fundamentally, it is imperative you have working knowledge of software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.

Description:
Job Description


REQ ID: 104981
JOB TITLE: Senior AutoSAR Developer
SALARY: Competitive
LOCATION: Shannon, Ireland

Dreaming for tomorrow is about more than ideas and ambitions. We're already building the next generation of vehicles, using repurposed and brand-new technology and techniques. We're doing more than dream, we're creating the future of mobility and automotive for years to come.



This position is for a Senior Embedded Software Engineer within Jaguar Land Rovers Software Development team in Ireland, delivering the software platform for our next generation vehicle architecture. Software development will include the definition, configuration and integration of AUTOSAR Basic Software components - for classic frameworks. We offer a dynamic work environment, the chance to grow within the company and to develop your competences in new technologies. This is a great role where you will be working with a supportive team and on exciting new products and technologies including automotive Ethernet networks, multicore application hosting and SOTA.

This position is for a highly motivated and experienced automotive engineer with responsibility for the design, development and delivery of our next generation software platform in an Autosar framework. You will have a record of production software development and delivery through all stages of the engineering development V cycle regarding software artefacts, requirements cascade, design, implementation, validation, and verification in an AUTOSAR compliant framework. You will be involved in the support of Autosar communication software within existing architectures with clarification of requirements, configuration parameters and tooling support.

Working with a team of System, Architecture, Hardware, Software and Controls Engineers, you'll aim to deliver concept and production systems in a timely manner, according to vehicle programme timing and local delivery milestones, whilst overseeing issue investigation and ECU diagnosis.

TCS is a purpose-led transformation company, built on belief. We don’t just help businesses to transform through technology. We support them in making a meaningful difference to the people and communities they serve - our clients include some of the biggest brands in Ireland and worldwide. For you, it means more opportunity to make an impact that matters, through challenging projects which demand ambitious innovation.


We are looking for


TCS is seeking an IT Service Desk Associate to join the Technology Innovation and Support Services department within the Donegal Global Delivery Center.
The technical team, work in a high profile, mission critical environment where early and appropriate responses are essential to providing technical support in relation to servers, operating systems, storage, databases & networks that manage and support applications & products.

As an IT Service Desk Associate, you will be joining a team built on collaboration, communication, focus and motivated to delivering excellent service and support. The team are responsible for troubleshooting incidents ranging from P1-P5 incidents both proactive and reactive. Incidents come in through telephony, web portal, email & alerting systems which will be managed by the team to restore services as soon as possible.

This is an exciting opportunity where you will be giving the opportunity to work with a wide range of technologies and systems along, with a continuous service improvement mindset and building on best practices methodologies such as ITIL/ITSM & Agile.

Languages required:
English
German




Required:

Desirable:

Desirable that candidate has IT Support/Infrastructure experience, Knowledge of IT Support Services, IT related education or Customer Service background. B2 or greater language fluency in both German and English.
